text:
<#C0106LZBVCY|ideas> this is about to be implemented in Israel.
Here's how it works: Citizens who choose to install the app will allow it to record their location up to two weeks back. Recording on iPhones is only possible when the app is downloaded. The location will be recorded and kept on the phone itself, and will not be sent out.
A person who downloaded and installed the app - if diagnosed as a corona patient - can send his or her route to a dashboard with the click of a button, only if he chooses to do so. This route will be sent to the devices of anyone who downloaded the app, and the devices will compare the tracks without sharing users' locations.
Anyone who was found to be in the vicinity of a diagnosed corona patient, according to the Ministry of Health's definitions, will be alerted that he must enter isolation. A person who has been alerted can choose whether or not to report to the Ministry of Health about their isolation.
<https://globekeeper.com/>

<#C010695DKMM|general> we need to make sure to consider to protect the identity of the patients as we have seen what the society is doing for the foreigners.

elements.text:
this is about to be implemented in Israel.
Here's how it works: Citizens who choose to install the app will allow it to record their location up to two weeks back. Recording on iPhones is only possible when the app is downloaded. The location will be recorded and kept on the phone itself, and will not be sent out.
A person who downloaded and installed the app - if diagnosed as a corona patient - can send his or her route to a dashboard with the click of a button, only if he chooses to do so. This route will be sent to the devices of anyone who downloaded the app, and the devices will compare the tracks without sharing users' locations.
Anyone who was found to be in the vicinity of a diagnosed corona patient, according to the Ministry of Health's definitions, will be alerted that he must enter isolation. A person who has been alerted can choose whether or not to report to the Ministry of Health about their isolation.
we need to make sure to consider to protect the identity of the patients as we have seen what the society is doing for the foreigners.

text: Hi- not sure if people have their data on at all in Ethiopia while Korea has the best internet in the world so might be a stretch. But I was thinking of doing self-reports by people diagnosed of their location data for 5 days pre-testing positive (can even collect via simple google form) then putting it onto a map? Would make contact tracing easier once a patient is identified and can help in making sure those locations are disinfected. Not sure if the contact-tracing team is doing this tho.

text:
<@U0107JERE9L> <@U0107AYF16H>

Having a hard time understanding where to support.. not a slack expert.. but here are some of my suggestions (point me in the right direction!).

All knowledge should be managed by audience (identified suggested audiences below):
• Doctors & Healthcare Workers
• People With No Symptoms
• People Experiencing Minor Symptoms
• People Experiencing Major Symptoms
• The Elderly & People With Health Complications
Knowledge should be broken into two categories:
• Principals (e.g. Safe Practices)
• Procedures (e.g. where to get tested, medical procedures for healthcare workers)
The reason for grouping the information is that it will aid how the information is collected, distributed and consumed by the intended audience.

Use the channels available to disseminate the information to the appropriate audiences.

elements.text:
Having a hard time understanding where to support.. not a slack expert.. but here are some of my suggestions (point me in the right direction!).

All knowledge should be managed by audience (identified suggested audiences below):
Doctors & Healthcare Workers
People With No Symptoms
People Experiencing Minor Symptoms
People Experiencing Major Symptoms
The Elderly & People With Health Complications
Knowledge should be broken into two categories:
Principals (e.g. Safe Practices)
Procedures (e.g. where to get tested, medical procedures for healthcare workers)

The reason for grouping the information is that it will aid how the information is collected, distributed and consumed by the intended audience.

Use the channels available to disseminate the information to the appropriate audiences.

attachments.fallback: [March 20th, 2020 9:36 AM] nebiyouermias4: Thank you for the warm welcomes. What we are having a hard time managing and raising awarness in Ethiopia currently is the issue of social distancing. Some of this societal norms are deeply engraved and proving hars to challenge. If we can brain storm some ideas on how to help solve this problem that would be great.

text:
Hello <@U010A0MPL2K> - Thank you for this ... I like the way you classified things.

Right now we have a google drive where we are collecting information and ideas some of which intersects with what you have listed. I have focused on 3 things.
1. Low tech ideas that can be adapted quickly
2. Ideas to protect and help healthcare workers
3. Creative ideas to help with the stigma of having symptoms or testing positing. 
There are folders with these three things at the link below. I will work on organizing and incorporating the things you mentioned. I will likely call on you to assist in some of those things. IN the meantime, if you can contribute to the three projects, that would be great.

<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1cucELjwKwoeNzHIcJWhY4zZzxRXL9rsS?usp=sharing>

text: Some of us are working on Social Media Marketing to raise awareness through Facebook and Youtube Ads. We can reach Millions within a day using this, which I think will go a long way. Maybe we should add a separate channel for this...

text: Are you considering audience segmentation? Not sure how to go about it but a thought that keeps crossing me: You would want to have a different message for the general public vs to a regular shop owner. A shop owner can get the virus from everyone that comes to their shop and give it to a lot more people through close contact and touching the commodity. I think a different targeted message will serve here.

elements.text: Are you considering audience segmentation? Not sure how to go about it but a thought that keeps crossing me: You would want to have a different message for the general public vs to a regular shop owner. A shop owner can get the virus from everyone that comes to their shop and give it to a lot more people through close contact and touching the commodity. I think a different targeted message will serve here.

text:
I was brainstorming on couple of ideas and I needed a perspective from you please.
I was thinking about teaching volunteer corps on small tasks in unlikely(hopefully) scenario of an outbreak, I think if we can streamline teaching nursing or other tasks that can be done with anyone with a degree we will be able to increase capacity of health organizations. LMS (Learning management software) can automate teaching process in sequencial curriculums that would be able to increase low level worker on demand. 

I have built an app for high school students, And from my experience, creating engaging content is majority of the work. For this case, it needs to be studied what takes time for the health professionals to do in the case of an outbreak. (Repeating and low decision work). Once we know the main constrains, we train cogs to do basic things to let the professionals do high decision making work.

Strength of a chain is directly limited to it’s weakest link, Health system like any other system has a weakest links. We train people (volunteer corps) to cover for the weakest link by making sure we increase capacity of that link. In that case the health system capacity increases. 

This is theoretical, I know how systems work in practical ways, but i have no idea about the Health sector.

Reference: Theory of Constrains and Murphy’s Law

text: I hear you <@U010B22ESES> - what you are suggesting is a good idea even where healthcare isn't as dire as it is in Ethiopia. I will bring up what you mentioned in a project meeting with leads that we are having soon. What I worry is the scope. Do we have the ability to implement to that level of change in Ethiopia at this time?

text: We are preparing for the worst, Strategically, best time to start planting a tree is 30 years ago, the second best time is now. If we can pilot a learning management app in one month with enough content to teach volunteers. If we can do weakly updates on the curriculum to relief different constrained health professional. It would be worth it to try. My fear is the health system will be over run before we even have the time to respond. If we have the App it would give us unlimited access to graduates from different professions to increase capacity on demand.

elements.text: We are preparing for the worst, Strategically, best time to start planting a tree is 30 years ago, the second best time is now. If we can pilot a learning management app in one month with enough content to teach volunteers. If we can do weakly updates on the curriculum to relief different constrained health professional. It would be worth it to try. My fear is the health system will be over run before we even have the time to respond. If we have the App it would give us unlimited access to graduates from different professions to increase capacity on demand.

text: <@U010B22ESES> <@U0107JERE9L> <@U010B7Q6XE0> Running this from a youtube playlist might offer a low-tech version and may actually enable for easier access (when time is importance). One thing to consider is that breaking the videos into specific tasks make it highly more valuable as a performance support resource. Keep the introduction video to the need to knows and then have support videos when they need to perform a certain activity. Just some advice, I'm also in the performance support industry.

text: Guys I would really like to see technical action- I don’t have enough time - lots of responsibilities that I need to handle.  Hope you guys don’t hate me if I say this {*I joined the team to do something not to read news here*}, thanks for understanding.

text:
<@U010A0MPL2K> <@U010B7Q6XE0> and <@U010B22ESES> - I am happy to find that there is a focus on the healthcare workers. This is the folder where we are pushing for ideas and initiatives to help and protect them. Keeping them safe is paramount.

I am trying to drive 2 specific things under this project:

1. What information can we share with the healthcare workers so they can protect themselves? This is urgent so we need this in a PDF version first. And we need it to be translated in the main languages. 
2. How can we aid in providing protective gear? DIY masks etc... 
Could you guys try and get people to drive these two initiatives to completion within the next 24-48 hours? It will make a big difference.

<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lVap5ylRncPf_dZA0b5qT_qZiUj0ziD7?usp=sharing>

elements.text: and

- I am happy to find that there is a focus on the healthcare workers. This is the folder where we are pushing for ideas and initiatives to help and protect them. Keeping them safe is paramount.

I am trying to drive 2 specific things under this project:
What information can we share with the healthcare workers so they can protect themselves? This is urgent so we need this in a PDF version first. And we need it to be translated in the main languages.
How can we aid in providing protective gear? DIY masks etc...
Could you guys try and get people to drive these two initiatives to completion within the next 24-48 hours? It will make a big difference.

text:
<!here> - <@U01084M48U8> has made a good point.
Let's all use this platform to share feasible ideas and turn them into actions.

If you find something interesting or practical for Ethiopia, please share it here. If it is feasible for Ethiopia, post it in the spreadsheet at this link. Please add your name and collaborate on how to turn the idea into action for Ethiopia. As Mike said, speed over perfection... so lets go from:

 Idea --> Research feasibility ---> Documentation ---> Execution.

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TteOUncrCUHNY5xOK9V1l9jAZw4mcWeXQHDSLtCY0tE/edit?usp=sharing>

text:
<@U010A0MPL2K> I agree that we should use the low-tech/most accessible - YouTube sounds like a great option for video materials. I also think we should see if the MoH already has translated PDFs with this kind of info.

I'm currently focused on the food delivery/ride share initiative - since there are so many folks on here looking to help, maybe someone else can step up here (if necessary). Speak up if that is you!

text: <@U0107JERE9L> Yea I manage to reach him through instagram direct message by chance. Although I'm wondering if we have the file video itself, why do we also need a Youtube version? Is it to share it across social media? And if so, does the video have to be from his channel only, since he gave us permission to use it? Apparently his friend's awareness videos are also being promoted across EBC and other media platforms and they said they like it. I'm just asking since we're time sensitive. Thanks!

text:
<@U0109G64E31> - I asked for YouTube since it is the easiest platform to share and make viral for most people in Ethiopia that do not have all the other social media tools.
The other reason is to try and get this to be played on TV. I want to make sure that we do not create any legal issues for whoever we ask to share the video either on their platform or on TV.
